fields.description:
How this occurs:
- On opening a repository by double clicking on one repo in the repo browser.
- On pulling
- On opening the repo browser for the first time

Workaround:
Create manually a keychain and allowing SourceTree.app and I always click on deny.

Even now if I close SourceTree I get lots of prompt. I closed around 40 prompts to get rid of them. The screenshot is the tip of the iceberg.
fields.summary: The keychain prompt recurs repeatedly

fields.description: The new bookmarks window doesn't retain its position when you move it and then quit ST and relaunch. The window will always be at the same location each time you launch the app.
fields.summary: SourceTree bookmarks window doesn't remember its position

fields.description: SmartGit does this--you see stashes similar to commits in the log view, so you know where they were created. Otherwise it is very difficult to manage stashes.
fields.summary: View stashes attached to source commit in log view

fields.description: I have custom actions defined, and I would like to have them accessible via the toolbar in addition to keyboard shortcuts. While having individual actions be available as buttons would be great, even a "Custom Actions" button with a drop-down menu would be sufficient.
fields.summary: Custom Actions Should be Available in Toolbar

fields.description: The new bookmarks window is now wider and each row is now bigger, just to display the same (for me) icon over and over. There is a lot of wasted space now. Can we get a preference to hide this icon and make the row height smaller? Also the ability to resize the window width smaller now too would be great.
fields.summary: Add preference to disable icons by each repository name

fields.description:
Previous versions have watch-like indicator of a current sync state: which branch, local or remote, etc... Now I can see that the only indication is a bold font which is not so useful, and which provides less information then before.
Restore lost marker please.
fields.summary: Current checked out branch marker has gone after 2.0.0 for Mac update

fields.description: Hiding SourceTree with cmd-H causes CPU usage to spike and remain at over 90%.  Process sample attached.
fields.summary: CPU usage spikes to over 90% when app is hidden (cmd H)

fields.description: Ability to push bookmark like "hg push -B bookmark_name"
fields.summary: Hg push bookmark support

fields.description: Tabbing (i.e. moving from different fields/buttons) works for most menus in the application, but when you select {{Next Action}} in the {{Git-Hg Flow}} menu, you cannot tab through the {{Recommended Actions}}.
fields.summary: Git-Hg Flow: Tabbing Does Not Work For Recommended Actions

fields.description:
After the upgrade to 2.0.0, it has become difficult to recognise the current branch. 

Please make the current branch more obvious. (Highlight, icon, label, etc.)
fields.summary: Make Current Branch More Noticeable

fields.description:
The existing tags combo in the "add tag" dialog box could be sorter more intelligently. I'd like to see "dotted" numerical values sorted by field, i.e. instead of 0.3, 0.3.1, 0.3.11, 0.3.2 they should be sorted as 0.3, 0.3.1, 0.3.2, 0.3.11.

Also, I'd like the option to reverse the sort order so that the highest number is sorted to the top of the list, this would make it easy to add new version tags to a project.

This should probably be an option as not everybody is going to use tags the same way.
fields.summary: Smarter sort order for tags

fields.description:
I recently had to change some file permissions without changing any file content. The Diff viewer correctly showed no changes, but there were no indications of the permissions changes. Since I had done this edit the previous day as a side thought, I didn't remember it, so I had to run git diff on the command line, which showed

old mode 100755
new mode 100644

It would be cool if this was supported in the GUI somehow.

Thanks,
Phil
fields.summary: Indication for File Permission Changes

fields.description: Please support linux. Since SourceTree runs on the JDK, this should be possible across all major Linux distros.
fields.summary: Please support Linux

fields.description:
During Hg unshelve operation, we can click on the 'Cancel' button. However, cancelling Hg unshelve does not work properly when there are a lot of files affected.

Cancelling Hg unshelve will stop the operation and the shelve will not be deleted but part of the shelve content will be added to the repository. Trying to unshelve it again will have an error.
fields.summary: Cancelling Hg unshelve does not work correctly

fields.description:
Currently a working copy's subtree configurations aren't sent to repository. This means that if someone adds a subtree to the project, and later another team members pulls the changes, he won't see the subtree in SourceTree.

It would be great if the sourcetreeconfig file under .git could be somehow also pushed to the repository.

For reference, here's an the interaction on twitter that triggered this feature request:
https://mobile.twitter.com/sourcetree/status/514475261342261248
fields.summary: Allow subtree configurations to be pushed to the repository

fields.description:
h3.Steps to reproduce
# Open External Diff Tool FileMerge on a file in SourceTree
# Switching the focus back and forth between SourceTree and FileMerge will make SourceTree hang
# Quitting FileMerge will make SourceTree working again
# Quitting SourceTree when hang will have a crash report
fields.summary: Hang when using External Diff Tool FileMerge

fields.description:
When pushing the dialog shows a list of branches that are selected to push to.

This appears to be ordered in case-sensitive AlphaNumeric.

For a project with a large number of local branches it is highly likely the branch of choice will not be showing in the dialog.
fields.summary: Make the push dialog scroll the show the selected branch.

fields.description:
The diff views are not scrollable during the selection of text:

- If I select text with my mouse and move the mouse to the top or bottom edge of the text view, it does not scroll (I can thus only select the text visible in one screen without scrolling).
- If I select text with my mouse while holding down the mouse button and try to use the mouse wheel to scroll, nothing happens.
- If I have text selected and use Shift+arrow keys to select more text, that text is selected (even outside the viewable text), but the view does not scroll. Hence, I can't see what I'm selecting.
fields.summary: Diff view: Not scrollable during selection of text

fields.description: When viewing or commiting large hunks of code, the horizontal scrollbar is at the bottom of the hunk, not handy when you have to scroll all the way down, scroll the horizontal bar and scroll back to the top to see what you want.
fields.summary: Horizontal scrollbar on large code hunks

fields.description: It would be great if the push dialog remembered the branches I pushed the last time, so I don't have to deselect the branches I don't want to push. Now it defaults to 'push all branches'.
fields.summary: Remember selected push branches in push dialog

fields.description: The 'refresh remote status' is now done in time intervals or manual. I would like to know if there are remote changes directly when I switch my mind to sourcetree.
fields.summary: refresh remote status automatically when source tree gets the active app

fields.description:
SourceTree hangs for a long time on large diffs. The UI is totally unresponsive. This shouldn't happen; it's better to bail out on large diffs rather than stop working for a minute.

Steps to reproduce:
1. Add the uncompressed Angular 1.2.0 file (available at https://code.angularjs.org/1.2.0/angular.js) to your Git, commit it
2. Swap Angular 1.2.0 for Angular 1.3.0 (from https://code.angularjs.org/1.3.0/angular.js); don't change the file size; commit it.
3. Click on the commit; at that point the UI freezes trying to display the diff.

After some time the diff gets displayed and UI starts working again. But if I do anything to this diff, e.g. scroll just a little, I get another freeze.


---
Update: The [workaround suggested below|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/SRCTREE-2665?focusedCommentId=1625373&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels%3Acomment-tabpanel#comment-1625373] has seen positive results.
fields.summary: SourceTree hangs for a long time on large diffs

fields.description: I forked tobie/specref on github.com, and tried to review some changes for biblio.json. This is a big file (ca. 5MB), and the diff is not shown. SourceTree shows diffs just fine for other json files, so the file type does not seem to be the problem. It seems the size is the killer here. I can view the diffs fine with external diff tools (I tried Appel's FileMerge, and Emacs edify mode).
fields.summary: Diff not showing for large file

fields.description:
When SourceTree is set to use Tree View, the staging area will be showing "directory folder".

If we right click on those directory folder and select "Apply Patch...", SourceTree does not auto fill in the directory folder path as the Base Path.

It should use the directory folder path as the Base Path when applying patch.
fields.summary: Selected path should be used as Base Path when Applying Patch

fields.description:
Currently, SourceTree open the Terminal and uses "cd /path" to the repository.

User might have inserting certain command to the Terminal before the command "cd /path" executed which will cause the command "cd /path" to be incorrect.

SourceTree should open the Terminal with a different approach, for example https://github.com/jbtule/cdto
fields.summary: Open SourceTree Terminal in a different approach

fields.description: If I have branch called 1.0.2 and tag with the same name and I try to push, I get an error message "matches more than one" or something like this.
fields.summary: Unable to push when having branch and tag with the same name

fields.description:
Since upgrading to OSX Yosemite Public Beta 3, I cannot open any Bookmarks to repositories that include changes to download. Double-clicking or pressing the arrow button does nothing. I can still open repositories that do not have changes.

The app also crashes frequently, though I haven't seen a consistent way to trigger it yet.
fields.summary: Cannot open bookmarks of repositories with changes to download

fields.description:
Git-Flow initialisation fails with "Cannot Create Production Branch" error on a newly initialised git repo with no commits.

To reproduce:

1) Create new empty folder, cd into it, and then do git init to initialise the repo. NOTE: you can also do this from within SourceTree
2) In SourceTree open this new repo, clickon the Git-Flow toolbar button followed by OK

-- you will get the error complaining their is no master branch, even though there is.
fields.summary: Git-Flow initi fails with "Cannot Create Production Branch" on new git repo with no commits

fields.description:
I've just downloaded SourceTree to my Mac and am trying to register my usage. When I click "Register Now - free" and enter my email address of "xxx@email.com" I get an error
Could Not Check User Exists
Parser failed with error

*Workaround*:

Register your license on my.atlassian.com from your browser and import it to SourceTree, using the option import license from file in SourceTree.
fields.summary: Registration failing to parse email address

fields.description:
Most of the screens that show the "hunks" of differences have a button to also view the difference in an external tool, also accessible with command-D on OS X.  I would like that option to be available when viewing the log for a single file.

Currently it has the same interface as the normal view for changes but it is missing the view external diff feature.

Thanks.
fields.summary: Ability to run external diff from log window
Source Tree icon has changed and crash as soon as I try to do a commit

fields.description:
Support pushing a tag that was not originally pushed when it was created.

Steps to reproduce:
1. Select a commit.
2. Right click. Select Tag...
3. Add a tag with a name and a message. Do not select push.
4. Select the same commit. 
5. Right click. Select Tag...
6. Select the tag name from the popup.
7. Click add.

Expected Result: The tag is pushed.
Actual Result: A warning occurs that the tag is being moved (it is not). Continuing causes the tag to be "moved" and pushed.

Push should be a lot easier than this.
fields.summary: Support Pushing a Single Tag

fields.description: Please add support to add buttons for custom actions in the toolbar
fields.summary: Custom Actions Icon in toolbar

fields.description: For more information check the attached video.
fields.summary: Double clicking status table header, opens first file

fields.description:
If I change the view with CMD-1, CMD-2 or CMD-3, there is no apparent keyboard focus. It would be very nice if the keyboard focus would be set just after switching views, so that I don't need a mouse to navigate.

My focus preference for the different views:
File Status View: Set focus to the list of unstaged files, so that I can immediately start to add them to the index
Log View: Set focus to the commit list, so I can start browse the commits
Search View: Set focus to the search field, so I can immediately enter a search term
fields.summary: Keyboard focus when switching views (CMD-1, CMD-2, CMD-3)

fields.description:
When a pull fails (e.g. due to uncommitted local changes), the progress dialog shows the error.

Closing this dialog returns me to the initial pull options dialog. Selecting the default ("OK") option in this dialog retries the failed pull, which is almost always useless.

It is natural behaviour to select the default option to close the dialog when an error occurs, and multiple users here have confirmed that they regularly accidentally start a second pull attempt because of this.

Best suggestion is to have the initial pull options dialog close before the progress dialog opens. That way when there's an error, there is only a single dialog to dismiss and confusion is avoided.

Related question: https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/5277557/closing-dialogs-after-pull-fails
fields.summary: Close Pull dialog (and similar) before opening progress dialog

fields.description:
First:
When merge encountered a conflict, source tree does not show a quick action for abort this merge, source tree does not show a better and clear look for conflict files, the raw text file make no sense, source tree does not provide a quick action for open external merge gui tools.
Maybe you can refer to another git client which do better in merge part.


Second:
It is about clone git repository. We usually copy from bitbucket and paste the repository url to the field in source tree. For me, I don't place all the repo in one directory. So when I choose another directory to clone into I mean to choose it as a root directory to hold repos not as repo root. Source tree should append default repo name just after the path I have chosen just now. 


PS: the attachments images QQxxx.png is for problem 1, and problem.gif for 2
fields.summary: The merge UI and operation  is not so convenient

fields.description: Check the screenshot. I have two branches and one tag at the same point, there is also the HEAD. It would be nice if I could hide the HEAD as it is useless to me. Also would be nice if there were some smart thing to show the badges in this cases somehow shorter.
fields.summary: Too many badges in branch view push the commit message offscreen

fields.description:
Using the interactive rebase interface.
1. Select a commit (not the last (first?)).
2. Press "Squash with previous"

Expected: The commit message is the "previous" commit message.

Actual: The commit message is the "squashed" commit message.

This is clearly backwards. Older commits are squashed into newer commits using the older commit message. 

Note that dragging a commit message onto another commit message creates the correct commit message.
fields.summary: Interactive Rebase Squash with Previous Commit Message is backwards

fields.description:
When downloading the latest update of 38MB, the update keeps getting cancelled part way through. I am using a slow Internet connection of 384 kbps downlink. 

Perhaps have the ability to lengthen update time out or resume download of updates?
fields.summary: Update cancelled on slow Internet connection

fields.summary: Source Tree Crashes on opening
When using interactive rebase to delete a commit, and resolving the conflict using "theirs", continue rebase never completes

fields.description:
This issue has been there for a few releases.
See http://screencast.com/t/5I9iUUIAHWu
http://screencast.com/t/1PEc0F6UOZ
fields.summary: Screwed up graphics in commit dialogue

fields.description:
When in "File Status" mode and composing a commit made from different hunks of the file, when clicking on "Stage hunk" button in diff file, the selection in the file tree ("Show Only" - "Pending", "Sort by" - "Paths alphabetically") jumps to staged file instead of staying in unstaged one.

This causes me to select upstaged file again in order to view which unstaged hunks I want to add to staging area.
fields.summary: "Stage Hunk" action in "File Status" for changed file selects staged file

fields.description:
When trying to clone git hub or bitbucket repo i am getting the error not a valid source path

when i click on Details i have the below message
error: Could not resolve host: (nil); nodename nor servname provided, or not known while accessing https://github.com/moulikasunesh/firstgit.git/info/refs?service=git-upload-pack
fatal: HTTP request failed
error: Could not resolve host: (nil); nodename nor servname provided, or not known while accessing https://github.com/moulikasunesh/firstgit.git/info/refs?service=git-upload-pack
fatal: HTTP request failed
fields.summary: cloning bit Bucket or git hub url

fields.description:
I have experienced this crash a few times. I'm not 100% sure what causes it. All I know is I'm working in the SourceTree app in a repo window, then suddenly I crash.

I've been trying to find a repro, but it happens so suddenly and randomly I've not yet pinned down a repro case. I'll keep at it tho.

fields.summary: Crash after switching a branch

fields.description: In SourceTree 1.6.3 for Windows it does not show the initial placement of moved file in the diff area. Also when file was moved and changed it is not possible to show diff.
fields.summary: SourceTree does not show the initial placement of moved file

fields.description:
It would be really helpful if git stashes could be manipulated in parts instead of only entirely.
The git stash allows for partial stashing on the command line, but is cumbersome. The more you need it, the harder it is to use it.

List of ideas in order of helpfulness:
- Delete a hunk of a stash: It would be real helpful if one could delete hunks (or even lines) of a stash: The reason number 1 of a stash failing to apply (and then properly get deleted) is that a tiny bit of it got manually reapplied while stashed, perhaps because it should not have been stashed in the first place (but partial stashes are not supported).
- Apply-and-delete a hunk of a stash: This could be the workflow for partial git stash that makes most sense and easiest to integrate into GUI.
- Adding hunks of unstages changes to a stash.
fields.summary: Support for partial stashes

fields.description:
SourceTree already supports a "Copy SHA to Clipboard", but it would be nice if this feature could be improved to copy only the "Short SHA", the first 7 chars, to the clipboard.

This would be useful when referencing a commit on github, or other web based repository, that automatically links to a commit. By automatically copying the Short SHA to the clipboard, this saves a little time when pasting so that you don't have to count out the first 7 chars and saves space so that you're not pasting the full 40-char hash.
fields.summary: Copy "Short SHA" to Clipboard

fields.description:
It would be great to be able to stash only the staged changes.
I might want to get rid of something that I need to get back to later.
Currently it involves too many manual steps to to.
fields.summary: Selective stashing

fields.description:
In the screenshot I've selected master on the right and "Current Branch" on the top.

When I click on another branch in the left view, the dropdown always jumps back to "All branches" which is unexpected/annoying.

I suggest if the user chooses "Current branch" then and only then it should stay there.
fields.summary: Switching between branches in the left panel should not alter the graphs branch dropdown

fields.description:
Giving the ability to open a Markup (.md) file in SourceTree through an overlay popup preview similar to how JIRA & Confluence render selected image attachments would be hugely beneficial for the end-user who may be disconnected from Internet access & wishes to easily view their README.md file for example offline.

Future interactions could even include a WYSIWYG type editor introduced into the diff area of SourceTree.

A great example of this is http://github-markup.dfilimonov.com/

Moreover,
By having such a feature supported, Atlassian / SourceTree would have one up on the Git GUI competition (y)
fields.summary: Render / Preview Markup (.md) files

fields.description:
I am trying to add a custom action "open with sublime"

To do this, I browse to the executable with the built in browser and have the result command like this:
/Applications/Sublime Text 2.app/Contents/MacOS/Sublime Text 2

When executing the custom action, I get this error in the output:
Sublime Text 2 "/path/to/Foo.java"
[..rest of the output is irrelevant to this issue...]
 
As the screenshot shows, the dialog stays open and cannot be closed, only canceled.

Not sure why the command starts with only "Sublime Text 2".
fields.summary: Custom actions command with spaces does not work

fields.description:
Custom actions expect a path to an executable.
It does not support scripting very well. Executing something other than existing commands seems not doable.
Instead of an exact "path to executable" and "parameters" it would be more flexible to have an input field for complex shell commands.
Current "custom actions" feels more like "external commands"
fields.summary: Custom actions not custom enough

fields.description:
Git interactive rebase dialogs: Editing commit messages, there is no way to press the dialog's positive button with the keyboard. Tab will not activate it, command+enter will not "OK" the dialog.
Must use mouse, brrrr!
fields.summary: GRI: Improve using input dialogs with keyboard

fields.description: I personally use this function multiple times a day, and this would help me a lot.
fields.summary: Add shortcut for amend last commit

fields.description:
As a user of SourceTree, I would like to rebase to a remote branch. I should not be required to checkout a branch in order to rebase to that branch.

Rebase works dandy to a remote branch. This allows me to just do a fetch without also checking out the branch and pulling the latest changes to that branch.
fields.summary: Rebase to remote branches

fields.description: The sourcetree trial has expired so it shows me the popup asking for my email address with a submit button, to register. unfortunately, sourcetree crashes when I press the submit button. This is sourcetree 1.9.7 on OSX 10.7
fields.summary: Crashes when trying to register

fields.description:
Committing symbolic links within SourceTree places text files in the repository rather than symbolic links. Deceptively the symbolic link will appear correct on the local machine that committed the link. Upon reverting or cloning the repo from the remote the issue is exposed.

Steps to Produce
$ ln -s 1.0/ current
$ ls -al
 
drwxr-xr-x   5 travisbader  staff   170 Aug 18 11:11 .
drwxrwxr-x  14 travisbader  staff   476 Aug 14 13:42 ..
drwxr-xr-x   4 travisbader  staff   136 Aug 14 13:42 1.0
lrwxr-xr-x   1 travisbader  staff     4 Aug 18 11:11 current -> 1.0/
 
##### Commit and Push via SourceTree here #####
 
$ rm -rf current
$ hg revert --all
$ ls -al
 
drwxr-xr-x   5 travisbader  staff   170 Aug 18 11:13 .
drwxrwxr-x  14 travisbader  staff   476 Aug 14 13:42 ..
drwxr-xr-x   4 travisbader  staff   136 Aug 14 13:42 1.0
-rwxr-xr-x   1 travisbader  staff     4 Aug 18 11:13 current
 
$ cat current
1.0/
fields.summary: SourceTree Corrupts Symbolic Links

fields.description:
Would love "hosted account" support for [O'Reilly Atlas|https://atlas.oreilly.com/].

O'Reilly Atlas is a publishing platform which leverages Git for version control.

I have no idea if they have an API.  I asked; waiting to hear back.
fields.summary: Atlas O'Reilly "Hosted" support

fields.description:
When reverting a commit, the Push toolbar icon doesn't increment its badge count. On consequent commits the badge still shows wrong number.

Attached screenshots with a single reverting commit and a revert followed by 2 normal commits.
fields.summary: reverting commit doesn't update push icon badge

fields.description:
That moment when you find a bug and squash it.

Then the doubt sets in: what were they thinking when they wrote this?

I would like to go from the file diff viewer, and be able to launch a blame against any line either unchanged or removed, that would take me to the relevant commit and show me what else was done at the same time, as well as the log file.
fields.summary: allow blame from file diff

fields.description: The default view when switching to a branch is 'All Branches'.  I'd like to see an option in this dropdown to say 'always start in this view' or something like that.
fields.summary: Preference to set 'Current Branch' view

fields.description:
In Mac OS X, the standard for window management is that windows are accessed from the Window menu, and their views are manipulated using the View menu. SourceTree breaks this standard by placing access to the Bookmarks and Hosted Repositories windows in the View menu. They should instead be in the Window menu.

For more details, see The Window Menu on this page of the OS X HIG:
https://developer.apple.com/library/mac/documentation/userexperience/conceptual/applehiguidelines/Menus/Menus.html
fields.summary: View Menu items should be in Window menu

fields.description:
I want to ask if its possible to sort remote repos by name on that list.
We have a big list and sometimes its hard to find what are you looking for.
fields.summary: Sort remote repos by name

fields.description:
i was doing a complicated merge and had several conflicts.

i used "accept theirs" and went back later to analyze the history of those files on the two branches.

to my horror, i noticed that "Accept Theirs" dropped history.  this is a known problem with git merge strategy and the work around is ALWAYS to use "git checkout --theirs <file>" instead which preserves history.  NEVER use "git merge –strategy=theirs".

for more info, see http://www.claassen.net/geek/blog/2011/02/git-merge-strategytheirs.html

on a related note, it sure would be nice to have branch controls on "log selected" so you could log selected for a specific branch or all branches to see what is going on such as after a complicated merge.
fields.summary: accept theirs drops history

fields.description:
Sometimes when trying to find the commit that changed a single file, using "log selected", all I see is the merge commit.

When I clicked the checkbox "Follow Renamed Files" on the log selected dialog, I am able to see the commit but there were no branch lines showing that it came in on the merge.

Log selected would be much more useful if it showed all branches with lines simliar to "$ gitk --all <file>".  See screenshot
fields.summary: log selected does not show commit tree

fields.description:
I have the "Do not fast-forward when merging, always create commit" option in the git preferences turned on. I was surprised today when finishing a feature, which had only one commit and no other activity on the develop branch since the feature branch was created, that the merge was fast-forwarded on top of the develop branch instead of creating a merge commit as set by my preference.

Git-flow should obey this preference.
fields.summary: Git-flow finish feature merge does not obey fast-forward merge preference

fields.description: When I select "Push changes immediately to ..." SourceTree is not responding so I have to force it to quit.
fields.summary: When I commit and push SourceTree is freezing

fields.description:
The sourcetreeapp.com is not accessible from Moldova. I tried from Germany and Czech Republic and it works there.

As the sourcetreeapp.com is not accessible, the automatic update feature on Mac OS fails with an Update error.

From Moldova I tried to access your site from 3 local ISPs and the result was the same. 

It seems to be a routing issue. If needed, I can provide traceroute and other diagnostic data from different hosts.
fields.summary: http://sourcetreeapp.com not accessible.

fields.description:
Currently, SourceTree does not detect the new Git global option 'commit.gpgsign' that is introduced in Git 2.0

It would be better if SourceTree can detect this option and perform GPG sign on all commits depending on the option
fields.summary: Detect the Git global option commit.gpgsign and perform GPG sign for all commits
The icons are all gone, and sourcetree becomes highly unstable

fields.description:
Just some suggestions:
It would be nice if I could display both my local revision number and changeset hash in separate columns, rather then an either/or choice.
Also, from a UI perspective, related nice feature would be having a "right-click" or somesuch bringing up options for what columns are available and controlling their display.

Thanks.
fields.summary: Mercurial Changeset & Revision

fields.description:
SourceTree already has an optional column guide for commit messages, but many git users follow Tim Pope's recommended commit message convention (http://tbaggery.com/2008/04/19/a-note-about-git-commit-messages.html) which suggests limiting the first line to 50 characters.

The vim-git package supports this by highlighting trailing characters in red. I usually try to write commit messages on the command line so I can see if my first line is too long, but it would be nice if SourceTree supported it directly.
fields.summary: Support "50/72" git commit format

fields.description:
The screenshot I attached does not reflect the perfect crash state, please read this.

Referring to the screenshot:
(B) must be highlighted in the table view
(A) must not be highlighted in the table view
I don't know whether (C) is needed for the crash
(B) and (A) might need to be a new and a modified file

To cause crash: stage (A) by clicking on the checkpoint without selecting its row first.
fields.summary: NSTableView crash

fields.description:
Hi,

I've been using sourcetree for some time now, and it's great.

There is one issue that is a constant headache when managing branches though: sourcetree does not correctly update the remote branch statuses, even if you select "Refresh Remote Status".

The setup we are using is with a remote Git repository running on Stash, connecting over a VPN.

Steps to reproduce:

- create a branch locally

- push to origin

- pull on another machine (or machines)

- delete the origin branch on any machine (lets call this machine 'A')

- select "Refresh Remote Status" on any other machine (anything but 'A')

- observe that the deleted branch does not disappear from the list of branches on the remote repo

Subsequently, if you delete the remote branch (from any machine other than 'A')

- observe these errors

error: unable to delete '<branch>': remote ref does not exist

error: failed to push some refs to '<repo>'

This is an issue for me both in the latest Mac client (v 1.9.7) and the latest Windows client (v 1.5.2.0), and for my colleagues who see the same issue.

I note that searching 'answers' throws up a number of discussions of similar issues with refreshing remote status, at least one of which refers to this exact problem in the comments:

https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/237303/auto-refresh-of-remote-status-in-sourcetree-not-working

https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/214369/how-do-i-see-remote-activity-refresh-remote-status-doesn-t-seem-to-do-anything

https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/47459/please-make-sourcetree-automatically-refresh-the-remote-status-on-opening-a-repo

In ﻿particular the comments from Piotr Hlawski and Cory Simmons in the first link suggest I am not the only person seeing this problem, and that it has been present for a while.

Can you confirm that this is a known issue ?

Thanks !

Bug / question was originally posted here :
https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/322605/sourcetree-refresh-remote-status-doesn-t-work-with-stash-git-for-deleted-branches
fields.summary: Refresh Remote Status doesn't work with Stash / Git, for deleted branches

fields.description:
Hi!

Have some files that have a "ç" in their name and while git handles that correctly on linux and on osx command-line, sourcetree mentions those files as unversioned and complains when adding these files that "pathspec did not match any files for git".

I'm running the built-in git version of the latest sourcetree on latest osx (10.9.4).

This is related to a question raised at https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/321885/git-sourcetree-on-osx-and-%C3%A7?page=1#322192


Cheers
fields.summary: git, sourcetree on osx and "ç"

fields.description: I'm experiencing very  frequent crashes whenever switching between branches or pulling from server - today source tree is systematically crashing on every pull. I've attached the last crash logs
fields.summary: Frequent crash

fields.description:
In early versions I was able to confirm commit from 'Commit message' text field with keystroke Cmd+Enter. Now it does nothing.

*Steps to replicate:*
1. Make some changes in files in repository.
2. Open that repository in SourceTree.
3. Click 'Commit' in toolbar
4. Write some text to 'Commit message' text field
5. Hit Cmd+Enter

*Expected Result:*
Confirm commit, same as clicking button 'Commit'

*Actual Result:*
Nothing
fields.summary: Confirm commit with keystroke Cmd+Enter is not working

fields.description: It would be helpful to have a way to reverse multiple files in the detail view of a commit in the Log view. Currently, there's a "Reverse File" option inside the "•••" menu on the right (diff view), but it applies only to one file, so reversing multiple files is painful.
fields.summary: Add "Reverse File(s)" to context menu in Log view

fields.description:
Since version 1.9.0 SourceTree does not show the initial placement of moved file in the diff area:
!moved_file_in_stage.png|thumbnail! !moved_file_in_commit.png|thumbnail!

'File copied/renamed from <xxx>' line was present in diff area of pre-1.9 version of SourceTree (I have checked it for 1.7.3).

This issue is checked for Git only, but Mercurial, apparently, is affected too.

Zip-archive with the testing repo is attached to the issue.
fields.summary: SourceTree does not show the initial placement of moved file

fields.description:
If one does a cherry pick operation and SourceTree yields an conflict then when one tries to Launch External Tool to look at the conflict Sourcetree does not launch it although the files LOCAL, REMOTE, BACKUP and BASE are created.

This works fine in a normal merge conflict. I don't know why this should be different but it is.
fields.summary: External merge tool not launching when merge conflict exists in a cherry pick operation

fields.summary: Error checking out SVN repo (converting to GIT)
Keyboard shortcut to open repo from list of bookmarks

fields.description: Please provide an option to specify how many items to fetch in the log list view. I would like to set this low (25 or 50), since fetching any information from our huge, huge git repository takes an extremely long time. This is a critical performance issue for us.
fields.summary: Setting to specify maximum number of logs to fetch from git history

fields.description:
The log view always defaults to "All Branches", even when I select "Current Branch".

I know this sounds minor, but it is a serious performance problem for our git repository, which is many tens of gigabytes, and has more branches than I can count.

Please make this filter setting sticky, so for my setup, it always defaults to "Current Branch".
fields.summary: Log view always defaults to "All Branches" instead of "Current Branch"

fields.description:
In Windows, I can always see my bookmarks, meaning I can always switch to another repo with a single click.  In OSX, the bookmarks only appear as a separate window, meaning I have to navigate to that window before I can switch to another repository.  When I'm working on a project with many repositories, this is a real pain.  

As a user working on many repositories
I want the bookmarks list docked in every SourceTree window 
So that I can always navigate to any other repository with a single click
fields.summary: Docked bookmarks list

fields.summary: Crash after changing window after creating a patch

fields.description:
There's now an OSX version of Beyond Compare available:

http://www.scootersoftware.com/beta.php

Would be nice to add a recognised option for this diff tool to Source Tree along with all the other comparison utilities. See attached picture for the settings used when added as an 'other' option.

Note: being able to invoke Beyond Compare in this way requires the user to install the command line tools in BC.
fields.summary: Add Beyond Compare as a Diff option on OSX

fields.description:
How about using tabs or a switcher for switching repos fast and have multiple repositories open at the same time.

E.g.
I work on 4 repositories at the same time - Now i use an seperated desktop only for 4 sourcetree windows. Using one window with 4 tags would be easier to handle (maybe also with some badges (mod, new, del etc.)
fields.summary: Use tabs to use only one Srctree-window instead of 4 (or even more - for each repo)

fields.description: Will be good to implement into source tre something like google repo. When a project is composed by many other subproject repo still is a good tool instead of git submodule or git subtree.
fields.summary: Google repo like feature

fields.description:
Once again I bump into this bug. Here's a video: http://screencast.com/t/9ZI0V0tl

In the attachment you'll find a file, which I'm experiencing the issue with.

This is related to https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/SRCTREE-2555, but the original got closed without being resolved and my comments are being ignored there.
fields.summary: Broken partial staging

fields.description:
First of all, thanks for all the amazing work that you guys do!

I wanted to make a small feature request for SourceTree. When I click the "commit" button, I want to look over my changes and come up with an appropriate commit message. But instead of seeing the changes staged for the commit, by default SourceTree shows me the _unstaged_ changes in the right-hand panel.

This is very confusing, as many times a day I mistakenly believe that I am about to commit the wrong changes!

I might humbly suggest that clicking the Commit button should default the right panel to displaying the _staged_ changes. What do you think?

This would make my life a tiny bit better, and I think other SourceTree users as well.

Cheers! Best,

Brian Christian
fields.summary: Default to Showing Staged Changes When Commit Button Is Clicked

fields.description:
With reference to a fixed issue, SRCTREE-982, when i try to load the commit template in MAC, it wont work. The same is working in Windows but not in MAC. Please let me know where I went wrong. I have my template file in the same place as of .gitconfig(/Users/mac7/*) and .gitconfig has the following setting in it
[commit]
    template=/Users/mac7/.template

.template file has the following content
[TEST]

Any help will be very helpful.
fields.summary: Unable to use commit template

fields.description:
I can't consistently reproduce this, and I'm sorry I don't have a screenshot (I'll add one next time this happens), but I've seen it quite a few times:

* I double-click a branch name to switch to that branch
* then I immediately select "Pull" from the dropdown for that branch
* I get an error dialog with a Git error along the lines of "couldn't pull because the current changeset is X and it should be Y".
* However, if I wait a second and then repeat the pull, it works.

I think what may be happening is that Sourcetree decides the branch switch operation has finished, and updates the UI accordingly, before git has really finished updating the state of the working copy.
fields.summary: Pull fails if done immediately after a branch switch

fields.description: I have to force quit the app about 10-20 times a day right now. This has been an issue for a while but seems to have gotten worse with the latest release. When tapping certain commits (seemingly ones which have a pbxproj file in them), SourceTree freezes completely and is unusable. If I wait a few minutes sometimes it unfreezes but then freezes once I tap anything else again, so usually I just force kill it via the terminal. Is there anything I can do about this? I can't use it at all right now.
fields.summary: SourceTree almost unusable. Constant loading and freezing.

fields.description:
When making a custom action and executing a script that has CLI color/font type encoded parts, no formatting is done.
For example:

Fetching origin
[1mdevelop [0m[32mup to date[0m
master [32mup to date[0m

Prettiest would be to actually format it the way it was intended in CLI, or if not possible, strip the formatting tags.
fields.summary: Formatted CLI output support

fields.description:
I often find in my development team that we start developing and in our enthusiasm forget to switch to the correct branch. When the correct branch is on the same last commit there is no problem, however, if it is on an older commit there is an error message to either commit or stash your changes. 
Would it be possible to for example create an alert dialog choosing either to discard local changes or stash and automatically unstash them after the branch switch?

(This usually occurs when switching from master to development when one has accidentally been coding on master)
fields.summary: Move uncommitted changes to other branch

fields.description: I am currently missing a feature where you can rebase all remote tracked branches at once. This is something I currently use git-up for (https://github.com/aanand/git-up). It saves the trouble of having to stash, change to every branch, pull (with the correct rebase-dont-merge setting turned on) and unstash to get your entire project up to date.
fields.summary: Rebase all branches at once (git-up)
